description: Sven Halek reviews mounting unrest, confidential citizen communications, and growing anger over vanished citizens. He proposes to the Council a citywide, public tribunal focused on BCI injustices, arguing it could channel chaos into institutional confrontation and restore some legitimacy.

The Council, under heavy pressure, authorizes Sven to draft an official announcement. Sven prepares messaging positioning the tribunal as an open-door process, welcoming testimony from all citizens, including the newly visible vanished, and promising transparency and healing for Stenograd.

Council issues Sven's citywide call: registration for a public tribunal on BCI abuses opens immediately. Citizens of all backgrounds—including 'vanished' individuals—queue to share their stories, many revealing despair and shocking betrayals.

Emotional testimonies pour in, exposing manipulated scores, disappearances, and personal betrayals. The hearings draw massive public engagement. Districts experience both cathartic reconciliation and resurgence of old rivalries as hidden grievances come to light.

The tribunal concludes in turmoil: previously hidden Council protocols are exposed, factions turn on each other, and community leaders and formerly invisible citizens jointly demand a total overhaul of leadership and the reimagining of the BCI.
